nl.esciencecenter.octopus.adaptors.local

Class LocalJobs

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.esciencecenter.octopus.adaptors.local.LocalJobs
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    nl.esciencecenter.octopus.engine.util.InteractiveProcessFactory, Jobs

    public class LocalJobs
extends Object
implements Jobs, nl.esciencecenter.octopus.engine.util.InteractiveProcessFactory
    LocalFiles implements an Octopus Jobs adaptor for local job operations.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jason Maassen
    See Also:
    Jobs

        public Scheduler newScheduler(URI location,
                     Credential credential,
                     Properties properties)
                       throws OctopusException,
                              OctopusIOException
        Description copied from interface: Jobs
        Create a new Scheduler that represents a (possibly remote) job scheduler at the location, using the credentials to get access.
        Specified by:
        newScheduler in interface Jobs
        Parameters:
        location - the location of the Scheduler.
        credential - the Credentials to use to get access to the Scheduler.
        properties - optional properties to use when creating the Scheduler.
        Returns:
        the new Scheduler.
        Throws:
        UnknownPropertyException - If a unknown property was provided.
        InvalidPropertyException - If a known property was provided with an invalid value.
        InvalidLocationException - If the location was invalid.
        InvalidCredentialsException - If the credentials where invalid to access the location.
        OctopusException - If the creation of the Scheduler failed.
        OctopusIOException - If an I/O error occurred.

      • getJobs

        public Job[] getJobs(Scheduler scheduler,
            String... queueNames)
              throws OctopusException,
                     OctopusIOException
        Description copied from interface: Jobs
        Get all jobs currently in (one ore more) queues of scheduler. If no queue names are specified, the jobs for all queues are returned. Note that jobs submitted by other users or other schedulers may also be returned.
        Specified by:
        getJobs in interface Jobs
        Parameters:
        scheduler - the Scheduler.
        queueNames - the names of the queues.
        Returns:
        an array containing the resulting Jobs.
        Throws:
        NoSuchSchedulerException - If the scheduler is not known.
        NoSuchQueueException - If the queue does not exist in the scheduler.
        OctopusException - If the Scheduler failed to get jobs.
        OctopusIOException - If an I/O error occurred.

              throws OctopusException
        Description copied from interface: Jobs

        Specified by:
        submitJob in interface Jobs
        Parameters:
        scheduler - the Scheduler.
        description - the description of the job to submit.
        Returns:
        Job representing the running job.
        Throws:
        IncompleteJobDescriptionException - If the description did not contain the required information.
        InvalidJobDescriptionException - If the description contains illegal or conflicting values.
        UnsupportedJobDescriptionException - If the description is not legal for this scheduler.
        OctopusException - If the Scheduler failed to get submit the job.

      • waitUntilDone

        public JobStatus waitUntilDone(Job job,
                      long timeout)
                        throws OctopusException,
                               OctopusIOException
        Description copied from interface: Jobs
        Wait until a job is done or until a timeout expires. This method will wait until a job is done, killed, or produces an error, or until a timeout expires. If the timeout expires, the job will continue to run normally. The timeout is in milliseconds and must be >= 0, where 0 means an infinite timeout. A JobStatus is returned that can be used to determine why the call returned.
        Specified by:
        waitUntilDone in interface Jobs
        Parameters:
        job - the job.
        timeout - the maximum time to wait for the job in milliseconds.
        Throws:
        NoSuchJobException - If the job is not known.
        OctopusException - If the status of the job could not be retrieved.
        OctopusIOException - If an I/O error occurred.

      • waitUntilRunning

        public JobStatus waitUntilRunning(Job job,
                         long timeout)
                           throws OctopusException,
                                  OctopusIOException
        Description copied from interface: Jobs
        Wait for as long a job is waiting in a queue, or until a timeout expires. This method will return as soon as the job is no longer waiting in the queue. This is generally the case when it starts running, but it may also be killed or produce an error. If the timeout expires, the job will continue to be queued normally. The timeout is in milliseconds and must be >= 0, where 0 means an infinite timeout. A JobStatus is returned that can be used to determine why the call returned.
        Specified by:
        waitUntilRunning in interface Jobs
        Parameters:
        job - the job.
        timeout - the maximum time to wait in milliseconds.
        Throws:
        NoSuchJobException - If the job is not known.
        OctopusException - If the status of the job could not be retrieved.
        OctopusIOException - If an I/O error occurred.

      • getJobStatuses

        public JobStatus[] getJobStatuses(Job... jobs)
        Description copied from interface: Jobs
        Get the status of all specified jobs. The array of JobStatus contains one entry for each of the jobs. The order of the elements in the returned JobStatus array corresponds to the order in which the jobs are passed as parameters. If a job is null, the corresponding entry in the JobStatus array will also be null. If the retrieval of the JobStatus fails for a job, the exception will be stored in the corresponding JobsStatus entry.
        Specified by:
        getJobStatuses in interface Jobs
        Parameters:
        jobs - the jobs for which to retrieve the status.
        Returns:
        an array of the resulting JobStatusses.

      • cancelJob

        public JobStatus cancelJob(Job job)
                    throws OctopusException
        Description copied from interface: Jobs
        Cancel a job. A status is returned that indicates the state of the job after the cancel. If the jobs was already done it cannot be killed afterwards. A JobStatus is returned that can be used to determine the state of the job after cancelJob returns. Note that it may take some time before the job is actually terminated. The waitUntilDone method can be used to wait until the job is terminated.
        Specified by:
        cancelJob in interface Jobs
        Parameters:
        job - the job to kill.
        Returns:
        the status of the Job.
        Throws:
        NoSuchJobException - If the job is not known.
        OctopusException - If the status of the job could not be retrieved.

                         String queueName)
                           throws OctopusException
        Description copied from interface: Jobs
        Get the status of the queue of scheduler.
        Specified by:
        getQueueStatus in interface Jobs
        Parameters:
        scheduler - the Scheduler.
        queueName - the name of the queue.
        Returns:
        the resulting QueueStatus.
        Throws:

        NoSuchQueueException - If the queue does not exist in the scheduler.
        OctopusException - If the Scheduler failed to get its status.

      • getQueueStatuses

        public QueueStatus[] getQueueStatuses(Scheduler scheduler,
                             String... queueNames)
                               throws OctopusException
        Description copied from interface: Jobs
        Get the status of all queues of scheduler. Note that this method will only throw an exception when this exception will influence all status requests. For example, if the scheduler is invalid or not reachable. Exceptions that only refer to a single queue are returned in the QueueStatus returned for that queue.
        Specified by:
        getQueueStatuses in interface Jobs
        Parameters:
        scheduler - the Scheduler.
        queueNames - the names of the queues.
        Returns:
        an array containing the resulting QueueStatus.
        Throws:
        NoSuchSchedulerException - If the scheduler is not known.
        OctopusException - If the Scheduler failed to get the statusses.

        Description copied from interface: Jobs

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        Throws:
